the thing that made Overwatch fun was the match-ups. so locking heroes literally ruins the game. and balancing all the heroes to feel the same is NOT a solution.
also i know everyone hate lootboxes but how are battlepasses better ? lootboxes are either pay to earn or play to earn and now i have to play AND pay under a specific time or it's wasted money?!! the old lootboxes were soo much better it gave the perfect intensive for me to keep playing.

i really miss what it used to be. Overwatch 2 is not better and only worse

å½“æ¸¸æˆä¸å†çº¯ç²¹ï¼Œå½“æ¸¸æˆå…¬å¸ä¸€å¿ƒåªæƒ³ç€é’±ï¼Œç©å®¶çš„æƒ…æ€€å’Œå–œçˆ±å°†ä¼šåŒ–ä¸ºç°çƒ¬ã€‚When the game is no longer pure, when the game company is only focused on money, the feelings and affection of players will be reduced to ashes.
The Overwatch 2 is just a pile of crap.

Overwatch is by far one of the best multiplayer FPS game I've played.
It popularized the hero shooter subgenre and is still the best at what it does.
The synergy of the heroes (both intended or unintended) and the sheer fun of the gameplay are what kept me playing this game over all these years on Battle.net; regular updates help as well too of course.
It is a very impressive result as the game grew from the ashes of a cancelled game, and since this is Blizzard Entertainment's first First Person Shooter game ever. These devs are true wizards.

When StarCraft 2 stopped updating, I just felt regretful because I didn't play much. When Heroes of the Storm stopped updating, I felt very angry because this game had been with me for a very, very long time. When Overwatch1 became Overwatch2, I felt very incomprehensible. He went from a good game to a bad game. And now, I have even lost my qualification to play Blizzard games. After that, I began to be afraid of playing games, afraid of all online games, afraid that this game would leave me. So far, the most I play has become a single player game. All of this is thanks to the CEO of Activision Blizzard, Bobby Kotick, a chubby pedophile, and a robber who can't work but only steal money. I really like the previous Blizzard company. He put his heart into creating a game and most of the time put players first. I also really dislike the current Blizzard company because it has become a den full of sexual harassment scandals. The founders have all left, and Blizzard Company only has this name left.

Can you guys feel that?! That's what disappointment feels like.

OW1 owner here. Don't waste your time: it's an unbalanced, buggy, mtx ridden shell of the original.
At least they released this travesty on steam, so everyone can see what's the community's opinion on it.

R34 is still going strong tho, so that's something.

Used to be a great game, ruined by terrible developers and monetization.
it's still ok to play, but it used to be so much better and still has the potential to be fantastic.
Don't listen to their community continue to add horrible changes and unbalanced characters while making an entire role useless worse version of the first game

I have played Overwatch since 2016. I really love playing the game, but I been losing joy playing the game. The battle pass was a good idea but to not give you the credits to bay it again. Like other game. and if you stay AFK for like a five mins. it will kick you out of the game.

I think this game has fallen off in terms of quality, enjoyment, and dev content.  Community content is pretty enjoyable, however the game will continue to exist in a single meta, and some heroes will remain imbalanced simply because of their design.  I still think that after all these years TF2 is the superior movement shooter.  If you're looking for a sweaty, toxic, and periodically updated shooter, this isn't the absolute worst game to get, but I wouldn't recommend it unless you're looking to come back to it after not playing for a while.

The same Over-watch you know an love, just with a 3rd of the charm and 69X the monetisation.

Tl-Dr.
The game is still good, it still runs smooth as silk, still has great gunplay/gameplay and at least thanks to the steam release, the queue times are lower than ever. 

Give it a go, returning player or brand new, just don't give them a single Â£, wait an see how they handle the game going forward before you do.

The good-
As mentioned above, the game still feels clean, quick and precise. the game just feels good in the hand so to speak (I mean yea it also did when it released like 6 years ago but can't take that for granted now)

The hero design is still incredible, dare I say better than it was. as OW1 came to end I personally didn't really like the newly released characters, but with the start of OW2 I honestly think they're really creative and fun (They're likely only putting in all that effort to sell the Battle Pass but Shhh that's a secret)

The community still feels pretty decent, I played for 4 hours last night an spoke to multiple people of differing languages, an none to my knowledge called me a slur or harassed my almost surely sub par game-play (I haven't played in 2 years be nice) which compared to a game like Apex, that I would say has a 30%  slur rate even though you can only even have 2 teammates per game. Puts this in good standing with me 

The game still feels just like it used to (Provided you already got the skins you wanted years ago) so it's a nice burst of nostalgia if nothing else

It's on Steam now so Blizz can see how the community feel (Oh no, that is not good feedback)

The Bad

Not only are free to earn skins gone , the prices of their replacements are just robbery. The OW1 skin system was flawless, lootboxes were nice an cheap, pretty plentiful for the players who didn't wanna buy them and we had so many events with free skins, it was nearly impossible to have a champ without at least one skin you liked before the end of the game a few years back. Now, I understand, the game was losing players year on year, so they lost monetisation too. But the solution to that, was not this, an it never will be. these skins are still filled with love an passion , but I am not paying the price of a Witcher 3 GOTY copy (and the rest) for one damned skin, for a character I may not even be able to use every game (due to roles and counters etc.

There is no doubt gaming is on the decline as a medium, the whole industry has never had such low skilled development teams, with such giant budgets, that yet still somehow still manage to be sent barrelling into the ground (See literally almost any game release of the last two years, not including Baldurs gate, my beloved) 

This then results in games that are sub par to what we have played years ago, at triple the price, OW's only saving grace is that at it's core, it's still a good game.

So fine, lets say you can deal with spending Â£15 on a singular skin *That would've been free 5 years ago* what do you have to look forward too, the answer is the awesome new heroes , it's so exciting when a new hero drops, how will it change the meta, will they be my new favourite? 

Hmm?
Sorry?
You're saying I have to pay to unlock a character that is literally required to make the game fair?
I see, yes , yes, sounds fair to me .

Yes, you can unlock them for free, and yes, that hero is comp banned for a week or so, but what if you happen to work for a living. Then you're sh*t outta luck buddy . gotta pay or be at a disadvantage. 

No matter how you package it, this is wrong. the heroes should always be free. If you REALLY want to make them paid, then at the very least make the hero obtainable via some weekly challenge that would ensure you have them ready for their comp release. 

speaking of. You can unlock missed heroes via the challenge section, which is awesome, what's even better is the challenges are super easy, besides one of them , which is.

*Drum Roll please* 

WIN 35 F*NG GAMES! 

You have to be kidding me, not just play 35 games, WIN 35 full games before you get the champ, simply put, this is impossible, of course you can win 35 games, but what makes Blizz think I am going to play 35 games if I have only just downloaded the game! I have hundreds of hours on OW1, that alone should allow that challenge to be crossed off the list. It's clear to me this is just a forced barrier to entry to entice you to buy the Â£20 edition that includes all the new heroes, which since I already have 3 of the 6 heroes, I can't even entertain that idea.

So far in our rant we have discussed blatant monetary gate-keeping on champs that may well define the meta, which in my opinion invalidates the competitive nature of the game like a meteor invalidated the dinosaurs , and skins so expensive after just 3 skins you could play Baldurs Gate instead (This is me telling you to go check that out instead, it doesn't even have paid DLC!)

Wow, I telepathically hear you say, it really sounds like they ruined what was once one of the best IP's in the industry.

Well Steam viewer, I still think this is all salvageable, do what BF2042 did and massively discount all the skins, release any old battle-pass champs via level up progression at a VERY low account level so even after 10 hours of casual play you have the whole roster and we might just be back in business.

*Low whispers*
Huh?
*More low whispers*
Oh really?

Well Steam viewer, it turns out this game is just non salvageable. I'm afraid I have just got exclusive news suggesting the PVE overhaul (The entire reason we were even ever expected to put up with this deep in the cheeks monetary frisking)  has been flat out cancelled, due to needing to reallocate resources 
*Click-Clack X30* 
Ah, I see, Blizz is currently valued at 72 Billion USD (Nearly the highest they have ever been valued at by the way)
so as I am sure you can understand they just can't afford to be releasing all that content right now, an no, of course they couldn't have just delayed the game another year or so and just kept giving champions for free like in OW1 ,  then how would they be committing robbery like the majority of other game devs these days. 

Silly Steam viewer, don't you see, a small Indie dev like Blizz need our help (And our souls provided they had a calculable monetary value)
 
Now, if you look on the steam store you might see an event pass for that new story DLC we were promised , ignore the fact that it isn't free, when it clearly should be given the price of the in game transactions an we are good to go!

Conclusion-

Gaming is dying an we are killing it , almost all games out today have this disgusting monetisation , some have free entry an then prices so high you'd think there'd been an error when they posted the store , some have paid entry and still pull this anyway.

The only way to stop it, is to stop supporting it, by all means, play OW2, enjoy what you can, but please don't give them any money. look what we had from 2000-2015. just go back an look at the games, MW2, Fallout 3, Fallout NV, Pokemon Platinum, Max Payne 3, Witcher 3. 

That's just a fraction of the games I love, that you can still buy an play today, that are leagues better than today's garbage, and it's usually a tenth of the price. Just look at the history of OW itself and you can see the heights of what the games industry once was. now it's trend chasing garbage , Unreal Engine 5 is all we have an will ever have and no one makes anything for the love of the game now (Baldurs Gate 3 my beloved)

I can't stop this alone , an with the TikTok generation being living brain rot, kids are gonna keep whaling on mom's credit card until they're homeless . But we can make a start, stop supporting this kind of predatory practice, force these big companies to sink or swim, stop using your hard earned cash to fund uninspired game development.

You wouldn't eat a pile of crap, so why are you consuming it just because the crap is digital
